item.description:
East Bay Bike Path, seems to be everyones favorite.  Very scenic and very flat. If you have never been on it, why not give it a try.  Yes it is a Tarred Path !!!

 

The distance to the Entrance of Colt State Park, is about 12 miles.  I plan to wait at the Entrance, for slower riders to catch-up. The Park is full of water views  and there are plenty of places for our break. Why not take a Break & Enjoy the Scenery. There are Restrooms, at Colt State Park.

 

We probably will split into a few groups.  Feel free to go at your own pace and whatever distance you feel comfortable with. You can always turn around if you start getting tired.  I am sorry, but unless the turnout is small, I will not be able to watch everyone.

On the way back, I may ride toward  Providence.  There are a couple of Hills / Inclines, for Training.

Directions:  Route 95 to Route 195 East, take Exit #5, Right on Warren, First Left on First Street.  At your second Stop Sign take a Right on Veterans Memorial Parkway. Follow Veterans Memorial Parkway  and you will see a Large Parking Lot on the Right.  I am not sure if the street # is 100.

Please note: Exit #4 Ramp is closed.
item.how_to_find_us: We are in the First Large Parking Lot on the Right
item.name: Bike the East Bay Bike Path
